result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard C White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution of $142.38 to be paid to Pick'N'Save listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Cash bail has bee applied to Court costs.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.  Court waives DNA surcharge..

Straight Time.
Apply 93 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Leonard C White in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  

State moves to amend the felony to a misdemeanor.
Amended Information filed in court.
Defense has no objection.

Defendant enters an Alford No Contest plea to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 2:
100 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
93 Days Credit.
Time Served.

Restitution: $142.38 (to be paid to the Pick'N'Save listed in the criminal complaint - to be paid first - then costs/fines).
Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the posting party.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

requesting an adjournment for the court date of February 19, 2015 and February 24, 2015 filed by Attorney Masnica.

Jury status hearing on February 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
